title: L-3 Nozzlenose D
paragraphs: The L-3 Nozzlenose D is a main weapon in the Splatoon series. It is an alternative version of the L-3 Nozzlenose.
The L-3 Nozzlenose D in Splatoon and Splatoon 2 is nearly identical in appearance to the L-3 Nozzlenose, with the only difference being the presence of its manufacturer's dolphin decal on the hose.

In Splatoon 3, the L-3 Nozzlenose D has undergone a noticeable visual change, setting it further apart from its standard counterpart: its build is now significantly lighter in color, with most of the frame becoming white and all of the darker blue elements shifting to a significantly lighter shade. It retains the dolphin decal.
The L-3 Nozzlenose D was released on 29 August 2015 at 02:00 UTC.[1] It has the same stats as its base weapon, the L-3 Nozzlenose, but comes with Burst Bombs and the Kraken.
- An Inkling standing with the L-3 Nozzlenose D equipped.
- Firing the L-3 Nozzlenose D in Blackbelly Skatepark. (behind)
- Official art of an Inkling holding the L-3 Nozzlenose D.
The L-3 Nozzlenose D was released on 6 January 2018 at 02:00 UTC.[3] It comes with Burst Bombs and the Inkjet.

The L-3 Nozzlenose D returns in Splatoon 3. It functions the same as the normal L-3 Nozzlenose, but has a different set and appearance. It has a its manufacturer's dolphin sticker on the side of the hose, as well as a light blue and white color scheme, as opposed to a darker color scheme on the original weapon. It was teased in the Fresh Season 2023 poster shown on February 16, 2023, and released on February 28, 2023. Its set consists of Burst Bomb and Ultra Stamp.
- The L-3 Nozzlenose D being shown off in the Fresh Season 2023 promotional poster
- The Tableturf Battle card icon of the L-3 Nozzlenose D.

Model of the L-3 Nozzlenose D rotating (Link to file)
For competitive tips about the L-3 Nozzlenose D
- Across all three games, the L-3 Nozzlenose D has had Burst Bomb as its sub and various forms of an offense-based special.
The appended "D" in this weapon's name likely stands for "Dolphin", matching both the logo of its manufacturer and the dolphin theming of the base weapon's name in some languages.
